intro: Vittadinia decora, commonly known as the showy vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Vittadinia decora typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
